basics.name: Bianca Brückner
basics.label: IT Lead
basics.summary: IT Lead, passionate about innovation, web engineering, and people & behavioral science.

work.name: ING Domestic Bank
work.summary: Currently I work as an IT Chapter Lead, responsible for 15 engineers, with mixed cultural background, technical understanding. My team is a mix of internal, onshore, and offshore engineers, split between NL and India. In my role I am responsible for helping my engineers grow and unfold their potential. For 30-40% of my time, I work in a squad as an engineer. The IT landscape consists of Java APIs, legacy applications, Pega and a multitude of DevOps tools (internal cloud, Azure DevOps).

work.name: Stippl
work.summary: Parttime developer for stippl.io, the company founded by my husband.

work.name: ING Tech
work.summary: I implemented a software prototype on an innovation project. More specifically, I built an internal analytical platform to visualize and analyze the internal API & interface landscape, and their respective communication flows. After the prototype was deemed to be succesful, I built up an engineering team with the skillset to release a first MVP to production. I became the product owner of the project, where I was highly involved in stakeholder management to spread the vision, and created feedback loops with the community. My role as the architect was to design the fundamental structures of the software system, and to figure out where it fits best into the enterprise landscape. Besides that, I was also involved in the software development as a fullstack DevOps engineer. At the end of 2019 I gave a talk on graph databases and the MVP analytical platform during the yearly ING Tech conference in Romania.

work.name: ING Modelbank
work.summary: In my STA position I worked on a reactive microservice platform. There I was part of the development of the full-stack Architecture as well as maintaining and extending the microservice application. As a DevOps Engineer I also maintained and improved infrastructure components like virtual machines and scalable containers. Next to that I created a small platform to share self-made technical tutorials of latest technical trends and coding education.

work.name: ING-DiBa
work.summary: I rotated three times within the ING International Talent Programme to improve my knowledge about the full IT stack. My first rotation was in IT Service Management. After that, I did a rotation in Virtualization & Cloud services, where I learned about the maintenance, creation and cleaning of VMs, CPU stress testing and gathered some RHEL experience. My final rotation was as a DevOps Engineer at Continuous Delivery as a Service, where I focused on Jenkinsfiles, microservices, Docker, Groovy and Java. During this rotation I also gave a talk on Jenkins and Jenkinsfiles during the yearly ING Tech conference in Frankfurt.

work.name: Siemens AG
work.summary: Master thesis on creating a CMDB using SQL. Also, I was part of the Women in STEM talent programme of Siemens. Next to that, I worked in the CLoud Technology Expert Group.

work.name: Dodd Family
work.summary: First working experience abroad as an au-paur in Ireland. I was responsible for three children, ranging from ages 4 to 11.

volunteer.name: Nuremberg Institute of Technology (GSO)
volunteer.summary: I volunteered for the university as a buddy for international exchange students. I helped them find their way around the German education system, the city and bureacracy (e.g. bank appointments, registering in the city).

trainings.name: Think Forward Leadership Experience (TFLE)
trainings.summary: TFLE  has been designed to help ING managers take their skillsets to the next level. Within four months there are series of group activities and self-steered online forums as well as one-one coaching to identify and build on the existing leadership skills.

trainings.name: React
trainings.summary: 3-day classroom training (HackCamp) by Hackages in Brussels

trainings.name: Functional Program Design in Scala
trainings.summary: Hands-on introduction to functional programming using Scala. Ranging from basic building blocks of the functional paradigm, to building to larger functional programs. Instructed by Martin Odersky.

trainings.name: Functional Programming Principles in Scala
trainings.summary: Hands-on introduction to functional programming using Scala. Ranging from basic building blocks of the functional paradigm, to building to larger functional programs. Instructed by Martin Odersky.

trainings.name: Docker Security & (Sec) DevOps
trainings.summary: Docker, Container & Linux Isolation, DevOps, MicroServices & CI/CD

trainings.name: Professional Scrum Master (PSM) I
trainings.summary: 3-day training organized by ING, after which I completed the PSM I certification

trainings.name: ITIL Foundation Certifiate in IT Service Managment
trainings.summary: 3-day training organized by ING, after which I completed the ITIL certification

trainings.name: IT Trainee Program ING
trainings.summary: The trainee program provided 3 global learning events with different sessions and trainings about personal growth and leadership skills, as well as the opportunity to work abroad.

awards.title: Yolante: Development program for women with a STEM background
awards.summary: Yolante program provided trainings (social skills) and mentoring from senior IT leadership.

inspirers.name: Stephen R. Covey
inspirers.description: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People

inspirers.name: Kent C. Dodds
inspirers.description: Tech Influencer on websites and React

inspirers.name: Hacker News
inspirers.description: Social news website focusing on technology

basics.personalDescription: This is a longer description of me, of my backstory, my backyard, my backfire, my backend, my frontend and my friends.
